task.title: Generate a Testing Certificate for Signing an Applet

keywords.indexterm: Oxygen XML Author ComponentWeb deploymentSigning an Applet

context.p: All JAR files of an applet deployed on a remote Web server must be signed with the same certificate before the applet is deployed. The following steps describe how to generate a test certificate for signing the JAR files. The following procedure uses the tool called Keytool, which is included in the Oracle Java Development Kit.

step.cmd: Create a keystore with an RSA encryption key.

info.p: Invoke the following in a command-line terminal:

p.codeph: keytool -genkey -alias myAlias -keystore keystore.pkcs -storetype PKCS12 -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -dname "cn=your name here, ou=organization unit name, o=organization name, c=US"

info.p: This command creates a keystore file called keystore.pkcs. The certificate attributes are specified in the dname parameter: common name of the certificate, organization unit name (for example, Purchasing or Sales Department), organization name, country.
